save_method.help_text: How outputs are laid out under outdir. Use 'flat' for <outdir>/<preexisting_output_tag>/..., or 'nested' for <outdir>/*/<preexisting_output_tag>/... (e.g. per-sample folders).

raw_reads_prefix.help_text: Prefix used when constructing the preexisting output folder name. With the default, preexisting_output_tag becomes 'raw_fastqs'.

preexisting_output_tag.help_text: Folder name under outdir that contains existing outputs to check for. Default is built from raw_reads_prefix + 'fastqs' (e.g. 'raw_fastqs').

existing_output_extension.help_text: Glob pattern used to discover existing output files in the preexisting_output_tag folder (e.g. '*.gz', '*.fastq.gz', '*.cram').

existing_output_id_suffix.help_text: Suffix used to derive an ID from an existing output filename. The filename is split on this string and the first part is treated as the ID (e.g. 'SAMPLE_1.fastq.gz' -> 'SAMPLE' when suffix is '_1.fastq').

outdir.help_text: Base output directory to scan for existing outputs. Typically set by the calling pipeline.

manifest_of_lanes.help_text: Optional manifest describing lanes / input data units. Leave null if not used by the calling pipeline.
